titles.title: To designate the Federal building in Wichita Falls, Texas, which is currently known as the Main Post Office, as the "Graham B. Purcell, Jr., Post Office and Federal Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services Discharged.
Miss Collins (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Solomon objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 422 - 4 (Roll no. 442).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR 10/7/94 S14801)

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 9/21/1993--Passed House amended. Designates the Post Office building at 1000 Lamar Street, Wichita Falls, Texas, as the Graham B. Purcell, Jr., Post Office Building.
